job_description: DoITT provides for the sustained, efficient and effective delivery of IT services, infrastructure and telecommunications to enhance service delivery to New York City's residents, businesses, employees and visitors. This position will have a focus on terrestrial and stream modeling to quantify sources of nutrient loadings and other substances, from the watershed and their transport to reservoirs. The main duties of this position will be to work with the Section Chief of WQSRâ€™s Water Quality Modeling Section to plan and develop long and short-term goals and set priorities for DEPâ€™s Water Quality Modeling program. Research will be conducted to improve our understanding of sediment transport and quantify how both natural and anthropogenic processes affect water quality. Will provide modeling, analysis and data support for water supply modeling projects by maintaining appropriate expertise and making efficient use of spreadsheet, database, geographic information systems (GIS) statistics, and programming tools as needed.    â€¢Will participate in the development of the Operational Support Tool for system operations; will plan and carry out the necessary activities to develop effective coordination with other members of the Water Quality Modeling Section, other DEP staff and outside agencies as needed.    â€¢Will create a library of model runs with documentation for reproducibility; will utilize appropriate and analytical and statistical methods in model calibration, testing, sensitivity analyses, applications and interpretation of model output. job_description: AMENDED **    The Prevention Technical Assistance Unit (PTAU) within the Bureau of HIV/AIDS Prevention and Control (BHIV) has a City Research Scientist I vacancy.  The successful candidate will work closely with a small team of Project Officers and the Director of Technical Assistance in order to provide routine monitoring and technical assistance to hospitals, AIDS service organizations, community health centers, community-based organizations, and other health facilities who have been awarded contracts to carry out HIV Prevention services. The successful candidate will be responsible for helping ensure funded agencies maintain a high level of technical quality and integrity of their HIV prevention programs.  The mission of the Bureau of HIV/AIDS Prevention and Control is to prevent and control the spread of HIV and ensure that People Living with HIV/AIDS (PLWHA) have the best possible prevention, treatment and care.    The Project Officer position will be responsible for working closely internally as well as with the BHIV Master Contractor and funded organizations to develop and implement their projects. job_description: The Department of Design and Construction seeks a Lead Safety Investigator to work within the Build it Back (BIB) Program. job_description: The New York City Department of Environmental Protection (DEP) protects public health and the environment by supplying clean drinking water, collecting and treating wastewater, and reducing air, noise, and hazardous materials pollution. job_description: The New York City Department of Environmental Protection (DEP) protects public health and the environment by supplying clean drinking water, collecting and treating wastewater, and reducing air, noise, and hazardous materials pollution.  DEP is the largest combined municipal water and wastewater utility in the country, with nearly 6,000 employees.  We deliver 1.1 billion gallons of high quality drinking water per day to 8.3 million New York City residents and more than 1 million people in Upstate New York, and we collect and treat an average of 1.3 billion gallons of wastewater per day.    Working within BWSO, Capital Program Management, under administrative direction of the Director of Capital Program Management, the Chief of JOCs/TOCs (Chief) will have extremely wide latitude for the exercise of independent judgment, initiative and action in the oversight of two program areas.  These program areas are Job Order Contracting (JOCs) and Task Order Contracting (TOCs).  The program areas will provide professional and construction services for all BWSO assets.  BWSO assets include all in-city and Yonkers reservoirs and dam facilities, water (surface and groundwater) treatment facilities, City Tunnels and associated shafts, in City aqueducts, drinking water pump stations, operational garages, various office facilities, water distribution and wastewater collection systems and other miscellaneous structures.    The Chief will be responsible for activities in several main areas.  These are:    1)  Development and administration of a series of JOCs contracts and a TOCs contract.  This includes development of bid documents (construction specifications and RFP), projection of necessary future funding, selection of best bidder, negotiating contract terms and conditions, contract initiation, all project work execution, project work payment and contract closeout.  This includes acting as primary interface with the contractor and consultant.  Ensures adequate level of contracting is always available.    2)  Acts as the primary interface with Operations in receiving and prioritizing work requests according to Agency needs. Establishes overall program scheduling (that is, relationships across Job Orders and Task Orders).  Tracks and ensures work is being executed within budget, schedule and operational needs.  Identifies and manages risks that may impact schedule, budget or quality.  Develops and implements necessary mitigative strategies.    3)  Provides staff with technical support on complex and difficult issues.

job_description: The New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (DOHMH)â€™s Office of Emergency Preparedness and Response (OEPR) was created to promote DOHMHâ€™s and NYCâ€™s ability to prevent, prepare for, respond to, and recover from health emergencies. OEPR is responsible for coordinating agency-wide emergency preparedness planning, exercises and training, evaluation of incident response and exercise performance as well as coordinating with community stakeholders, city, state, and federal partners on public health emergency planning and response.   The Community Engagement and Response Unit within OEPR is responsible for collaborating and engaging NYC community organizations, vulnerable populations service providers and leaders to build stronger communities in order to prepare their organizations and communities to respond to and quickly recover from public health emergencies.   --The Community Preparedness Program Manager will lead the vision and implementation of an exciting and innovative new emergency preparedness initiative that builds community resilience within key sectors to support public health emergency preparedness and response.  --OEPR seeks to create a Community Preparedness Program (CPP) engaging existing public and private community partners within New York City in the development of functional sector-based preparedness and response networks to improve citywide Emergency Preparedness and Response.  --Organizations will be selected to serve as the central â€œhubâ€ to support all hazards preparedness and response for their respective sector.   --The CPP Manager will oversee all aspects of development and implementation of the CPP, including but not limited to: setting goals/priorities of CPP, manage two Sector Coordinators, overseeing their sector portfolios and ensuring their professional development.  -- oversee solicitation, selection, contract process and successful completion of contract deliverables of selected community organizations as well as evaluation to inform future steps.  -- Represent the agency at agency, city and community events.   Additional responsibilities include: participating in emergency related trainings and exercises as required and reporting to work during emergencies including non-business hours. job_description: The New York City Department of Environmental Protection (DEP) protects public health and the environment by supplying clean drinking water, collecting and treating wastewater, and reducing air, noise, and hazardous materials pollution.  DEP is the largest combined municipal water and wastewater utility in the country, with nearly 6,000 employees.  We deliver 1.1 billion gallons of high quality drinking water per day to 8.3 million New York City residents and more than 1 million people in Upstate New York, and we collect and treat an average of 1.3 billion gallons of wastewater per day. job_description: The New York City Department of Correction has a unique opportunity for a Reentry Coordinator in the Reentry Services Unit.  The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring the effective delivery of the Individualized Correction Achievement Network (I-CAN) program.  I-CAN is an innovative, state-of-the-art reentry initiative designed to reduce recidivism among inmates who are at moderate to high risk of re-offending.  Inmates who participate in the program receive a broad range of jail-and community-based services, including employment assistance, housing, family support, and substance use treatment.    Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:  â€¢	Ensuring the effectiveness of I-CAN services at one or more facilities.  Collaborating with contracted providers and serving as a liaison between providers and DOC staff. Escalate any provider and/or DOC operation/issues as they arise.   â€¢	Contribute to the development of innovative strategies to maximize program participation and performance.  Evaluating program performance against targets. Tracking program participation and preparing reports to document activities.    â€¢	Coordinating program activities, including scheduling of on-going activities, planning special events, and assembling workshop class calendars.  Carrying out special projects to advance the goals of the Reentry Services unit.  â€¢	Using motivational interviewing and other techniques to engage inmates in reentry services and assess their needs, including employment, housing, and substance use.  Refer inmates to partner organizations for services.   Documenting inmate assessments utilizing appropriate reporting mechanisms, including web-based data collection systems.  â€¢	Monitoring program participation and retention. Following up with program participants to obtain feedback on I-CAN services and to ensure that their program-related needs are being met.  â€¢	Developing partnerships and collaborative relationships with service providers to ensure smooth service delivery.   â€¢	Assisting in the development of short and long term plans for reentry programming. Researching best practices to inform program improvement.  Carrying out special projects to support reentry services.  â€¢	Preparing presentation materials, reviewing reports and documents, prioritizing and managing multiple projects simultaneously, and performing other duties as assigned.

job_description: The Treasury and Payment Services Division of the Department of Finance has over 500 staff and oversees the agency's management of City cash balances and relationships with banking institutions, oversight of all City payment websites, document and payment processing of tax returns, property recording forms, parking violation programs, and collection of delinquent accounts. business_title_phonetic: Director of Research and Evaluation, School Health
job_description: The Office of School Health (OSH) is a joint Program of the Department of Education and the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene responsible for promoting the health of the 1.2 million school children enrolled in approximately 1,800 public and non 'public schools in the New York City. OSH has health records on all these students and collects vital health and wellness information in the Automated Student Health Record (ASHR) System. The OSH has implemented and maintained several school-based programs in the recent years, including obesity-prevention programs, asthma case management and education programs, and in-school reproductive health programs at the high school level. Monitoring and evaluation of these programs through analysis of ASHR data will be the main focus of the Director of Research and Evaluation.   With wide latitude for independent and creative thinking and execution, the Director of Research and Evaluation will be responsible for the development and implementation of all OSH program evaluation activities, developing and implementing a bureau-wide research agenda, liaising with the Division Research Director, Bureau directors, internal and external partners on collaborative research, preparing data sharing, confidentiality and IRB documents, data reports and manuscripts. Specific responsibilities will include but not be limited to:   â€¢	Design, implement and supervise research, program monitoring and evaluation activities to lead and support the Bureauâ€™s work.  â€¢	Evaluate, analyze and interpret data from ASHR, using statistical procedures, depending on analytic needs, working closely with the OSH Director of MIS.  â€¢	Collaborate with Program Directors on evaluation and data system needs and creation of reporting tools for program and management evaluation.  â€¢	Collaborate with Nursing, Medical, MIS and Bureau of Immunization to develop electronic data system for submission of school health forms via the City-wide Immunization Registry.  â€¢	Quickly synthesize and summarize information from scientific literature and a variety of other sources.   â€¢	Build and maintain collaborative partnerships with internal, DOE and external researchers and develop common goals.  â€¢	Demonstrate program efficacy and accountability and identify best program practices and recommend program modifications for improvements.  â€¢	Develop and oversee the preparation of monthly, quarterly and annual reports monitoring the progress of all objectives towards short and long-term objectives.  â€¢	Author and execute scientific presentations, reports and manuscripts for senior directors, external stakeholders and the public.   â€¢	Oversee the dissemination of data at scientific and trade conferences, meetings, and seminars.  â€¢	Supervise and provide guidance to research staff.   â€¢	Work collaboratively with the Division Research Director as part of a broader research team.

job_description: The Field Services Unit in the HIV Epidemiology and Field Services Program (HEFSP) is responsible for providing HIV partner services and linkage to care to HIV-diagnosed persons in New York City (NYC), including the collection, analysis, and dissemination of service data of participating patients. The Project Manager/Analyst will be the lead manager and analyst for the Unitâ€™s HIV Linkage to Care initiatives and may be asked to contribute to a wide range of activities, including both routine program operational research, as well as special investigative studies, and the Expanded Partner Services (ExPS) and High Impact Care and Prevention Project (HICAPP) grants. ExPS and HICAPP are New York State-funded, multi-year enhanced linkage to care projects designed to assist select community providers and patient lost to HIV follow-up care with re-linkage to care. job_description: The Division of Technology Service and Development (TSD) within the Department of Housing Preservation and Development (HPD) is seeking to fill a new Quality Assurance (QA) Specialist position for quality assurance of IT products.  The QA Specialist will report to the TSD Quality Assurance Manager.  Through close collaboration with business analyst and technical staff, the QA Specialist will ensure the quality of IT applications.  The QA Specialist will prepare/present test plans for new and legacy and new IT applications, in accordance with the application business requirements and employ both manual and automated testing through the development and execution of test cases.  The QA Specialist will ensure compliance by following testing best practices and standards, be accountable for providing scope of work estimates, and provide QA status to the project team.   Demonstrate effective communication and interpersonal skills.  Expert knowledge of automated test tools, as well as, working knowledge of a data base query language, Microsoft Word, Excel, Visio, Outlook and SharePoint is required.
minimum_qual_requirements: (1) A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college, including or supplemented by twenty-four (24) semester credits in computer science or a related computer field and two (2) years of satisfactory full-time software experience in designing, programming, debugging, maintaining, implementing, and enhancing computer software applications, systems programming, systems analysis and design, data communication software, or database design and programming, including one year in a project leader capacity or as a major contributor on a complex project; or  (2) A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent and six (6) years of full-time satisfactory software experience as described in â€œ1'' above, including one year in a project leader capacity or as a major contributor on a complex project; or  (3) A satisfactory combination of education and experience that is equivalent to (1) or (2) above. College education may be substituted for up to two years of the required experience in (2) above on the basis that sixty (60) semester credits from an accredited college is equated to one year of experience. A masters degree in computer science or a related computer field may be substituted for one year of the required experience in (1) or (2) above. However, all candidates must have a four year high school diploma or its educational equivalent, plus at least one (1) year of satisfactory full-time software experience in a project leader capacity or as a major contributor on a complex project.  NOTE: In order to have your experience accepted as Project Leader or Major Contributor experience, you must explain in detail how your experience qualifies you as a project leader or as a major contributor. Experience in computer operations, technical support, quality assurance (QA), hardware installation, help desk, or as an end user will not be accepted for meeting the minimum qualification  requirements.  Special Note  To be eligible for placement in Assignment Level IV, in addition to the Qualification Requirements stated above, individuals must have one year of satisfactory experience in a project leader capacity or as a major contributor on a complex project in data administration, database management systems, operating systems, data communications systems, capacity planning, and/or on-line applications programming.
preferred_skills: A Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college in an IT or analytical discipline and two years QA experience.  Proven experience with QA testing of large scale, multi-tiered, integrated systems.   Experience with performance test script set up and execution (Load Runner experience preferred).    Experience writing and execution manual test cases.  Plan test schedules or strategies in accordance with project scope or delivery dates.  Track and monitor bug resolution efforts.  Experience with automated testing (QTP experience preferred).    Experience with performance testing (Load Runner preferred).  Experience with database and white box testing.   Experience with web based application testing.   Experience with Data Migration Testing, ETL, BI Tools and/or Data Warehouse testing.  Good understanding of SQL Server databases and constructing / executing SQL queries.  Ability to work independently and multi-task.   Strong verbal and written communication skills.

job_description: The New York City Department of Correction has a unique opportunity for a Senior Program Associate in the Reentry Services Unit.  The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring the effective delivery of the Individualized Correction Achievement Network (I-CAN) program.  I-CAN is an innovative, state-of-the-art reentry initiative designed to reduce recidivism among inmates who are at moderate to high risk of re-offending.  Inmates who participate in the program receive a broad range of jail- and community-based services, including employment assistance, housing, family support, and substance use treatment.  The recruited candidate must be well-organized, proactive, resourceful, flexible, able to communicate with staff (at all levels) in a fast-paced environment, meet deadlines, and perform with a high level of professionalism.  Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:  â€¢	Under the direction of Executive Director of Reentry Services and Program Innovation, implementing innovative programming to reduce recidivism among inmates in DOC custody.  â€¢	Evaluating program performance against established goals.  Identifying areas of improvement and developing action plans to reach performance goals.  â€¢	Developing a performance measurement system, including data collection, reporting, and interpreting findings. Leverage performance measurement systems to inform program planning and strategy efforts.  â€¢	Conducting best practice research and striving to reach delivery of the highest quality re-entry services to the inmate population.  Seeking expertise on developments in re-entry services to create a strategic vision to incorporate best practices from both inside and outside the Department.    â€¢	Write reports, briefings, policy memos, research articles, newsletters and other written materials about I-CAN, other reentry initiatives, as well as best practices in the field.  â€¢	Developing and implementing innovative strategies to maximize program participation and performance.  Evaluating program performance against targets.   â€¢	Developing partnerships and collaborative relationships with service providers to ensure smooth service delivery.   â€¢	Assisting in the development of short and long term plans for reentry programming.  Carrying out special projects to support reentry services.  â€¢	Preparing presentation materials, reviewing reports and documents, prioritizing and managing multiple projects simultaneously, and performing other duties as assigned.

job_description: The Office of Chief Medical Examiner investigates cases of persons who die within New York City from criminal violence, by accident, by suicide, suddenly when in apparent health, when unattended by a physician, in a correctional facility or in any  suspicious or unusual manner or where an application is made pursuant to law for a permit to cremate a body of a person.    We exist to provide answers in support of families, victims and community during times of profound need.  JOB DESCRIPTION OCME seeks a candidate who will possess minimally the technical skills listed and also the potential to exemplify this agencyâ€™s core values of â€œIntegrity, Dedication and putting the Agency Firstâ€. Under direction, oversees the activities of the mortuaries under the auspices of the Office of Chief Medical Examiner (OCME).  Typical tasks include but are not limited to the following: â€¢ Assists the Mortuary Borough Supervisor in the day to day operation. â€¢ Monitor and supervise City Morgue Technicians in Mortuary Procedures (Autopsy, METT, and Check in, Storage, Release of Remains, and Fingerprinting).  â€¢ Prepares list of remains for purpose of City Burial, Medical School and Embalming School. â€¢ Prepares Incident Reports, Schedules and Statistics. â€¢ Checks Case Management System (CMS) and EDRS (Electronic Death Reporting System) for all documents (Death Certificates, Burial Permits) relating to the Intake and Release of Remains. â€¢ Ensures that Mortuary Staff are in compliance with all DOHMH, State, Local and OCME policies and procedures. â€¢ Ensures that the Morgue is properly cleaned and sanitized Daily. â€¢ Reports all complaints, accidents and any incidents within the Mortuary to the proper personnel. â€¢ Covers City Morgue Technician Duties as needed.  â€¢ Weigh remains, lift remains onto autopsy table and assist Medical Examiners in all autopsy procedures. â€¢ Boxes and Loads City Burial as needed. â€¢ Covers driving Mortuary Van as needed. â€¢ Takes Fingerprints of remains before during or after autopsy. â€¢ Performs in-house case reconciliations. â€¢ Other duties as assigned
